responses.content: When I look back at the dreams that we've had and what the social enterprise means over the last couple decades, it's a very rich user interface that kind of front ends all of our services. And the idea is how can you take all of that and bring it to the user, to the power professional, to the worker, to the knowledge user, or even to me, the CEO, and turn it into a powerful experience? And now, with this combination of Slack and Salesforce, exactly as I mentioned, my whole world is on this platform, and we call it Customer 360...
Our intention is to help our customers connect with their customers in new ways. We want to be the number one CRM, the number one in analytics, and remain tightly focused...
This moment is both humbling and bittersweet. We've had to reimagine our business and remain relevant by transforming how we engage with customers digitally...

We've made changes at Salesforce that we are advising our clients to make, how to get their employees to participate. We have 54,000 employees. For us to achieve these results, everybody has to be on the field and playing the game. We have to also give them the incentive to play, to train them, to keep them motivated...
We're seeing a 600% increase in messaging channels usage and 89% year-over-year growth in Commerce Cloud. Our Service Cloud continues to deliver robust growth, now surpassing Sales Cloud...
Examples like Sonos and Standard Bank illustrate the power of our Customer 360 platform and the importance of integrating sales and service to transform businesses...
Over 100% year-over-year GMV growth reflects the broad digitization of commerce. Our Commerce Cloud integrates B2C and B2B commerce, facilitating seamless customer experiences...
Our ability to pivot quickly and remain agile has been crucial. We're meeting customers where they are and providing solutions that address their immediate and long-term needs...

Our philosophy is very similar to our philosophy with MuleSoft and Tableau, which is, number one, starting with our mutual customers and how we can help them benefit from the combination of these two technologies. Slack is really the system of engagement for every employee, partner, and customer interaction...
For Q2, CRPO bookings are expected to grow at approximately 16% to 17%. We're anticipating a recovery in FY 2022, aligning with our conservative outlook on the demand environment...

We raised our full-year operating margin improvement guide by 75 basis points. While specific details on pullforward of expenses are not quantified, the improvement is driven by investments in growth areas and T&E savings...

Slack's business profile will be factored into our overall business for next year. The acquisition is dilutive to our operating margin due to purchase accounting, but specifics will be provided in the Q4 call...
We're focusing on delivering growth, profitability, and cash flow over the long-term. While we benefit from T&E savings, our primary focus remains on strategic investments in growth areas...

Strengthening our pipeline has been very encouraging, coming from different market segments, regions, and products. We're optimistic about both large and small deals across our distribution organization...
Our relevance to customers has never been stronger. Products like Work.com are essential for businesses to operate safely and effectively in the current environment...
Confidence is building almost week by week. We're seeing better visibility for bookings not just in Q2 but into Q3 and Q4 as well. Our products remain highly relevant, especially Work.com...
Customers recognize the imperative to accelerate digital transformation. Our solutions enable them to pivot quickly and address their evolving needs...
During Q3, we saw a continuation of the strong demand that we saw in Q2, with a well-rounded performance across all the clouds and both in the US and internationally...

Slack provides access to rich conversational customer data, advancing our AI efforts. It serves as the operating system for growth, facilitating team selling, customer service, and marketing in the all-digital work-from-anywhere world...

Our agility allows us to maintain the grip of a small company while managing to grow into a 21-plus billion dollar company. This has been crucial in responding to changing customer needs and delivering transformation solutions...

responses.content: Executing our plans in line with our core values—trust, customer success, innovation, and equality—has strengthened our relationships with customers and communities...
Public sector engagements have been a great success. Teams have quickly mobilized to support states like Rhode Island, demonstrating our ability to partner effectively and deliver value...
CRM has evolved significantly over the past two decades, driven by the Fourth Industrial Revolution. Our mission remains to stay ahead through organic innovation and strategic acquisitions...
Work.com has been pivotal in helping businesses and schools operate safely. Building trust with customers has been key to our success and resilience during the crisis...

responses.content: Thank you for joining us on the call today. If you have any follow-up questions, please e-mail us at investor@salesforce.com. We look forward to speaking with you on our Q4 results call in September...

questions: Marc Benioff, given Slack's access to huge amounts of rich conversational customer data, how do you see that advancing your efforts around AI? Also, what's your vision for what Slack could be with Salesforce in three to five years?

Can you compare and contrast the strategy to integrate Slack versus what you've done with Tableau or MuleSoft? Additionally, Mark Hawkins, regarding expense management, how does Slack impact operating margins and what should we expect for margins next year?

Marc and Gavin, how do you view the demand environment from a pipeline perspective for the fourth quarter? How are priorities changing through this pandemic, and how do you think about opportunities to solve these pain points? Also, why acquire Slack now instead of before or next year?
Can you break down the components driving the 75 basis points operating margin improvement guide? Specifically, how much is coming from T&E savings and can you quantify the pullforward of expenses?
Can you talk about the dynamics you see in Service Cloud and how you think about the sustainability of its growth on a go-forward basis?

In this new environment, what are you seeing in terms of customer engagement and deal size? How are you shifting Dreamforce to an online format, and how does that relate to your go-to-market investments?
How does Tableau enhance Customer 360 and support digital transformation for industries looking into 2021 and 2022?
